sub_topic: Calculation of Carnot efficiency of a heat engine
message_1: A heat engine operates between two temperature reservoirs at temperatures 400 K and 100 K. Calculate the maximum efficiency of the heat engine using the Carnot cycle.
message_2:
The maximum efficiency of a heat engine operating between two temperature reservoirs can be determined using the Carnot efficiency formula:

Efficiency (η) = 1 - (T_cold / T_hot)

where T_cold is the temperature of the cold reservoir and T_hot is the temperature of the hot reservoir. The temperatures must be in Kelvin.

In this case, T_cold = 100 K and T_hot = 400 K.

Efficiency (η) = 1 - (100 K / 400 K) = 1 - 0.25 = 0.75

The maximum efficiency of the heat engine using the Carnot cycle is 75%.
